trans-unit.source: Automate protection between an on-premises VMM site and Azure using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Automate protection between an on-premises VMM site and Azure using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Automate the deployment of Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Automate the deployment of Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Deploy Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Deploy Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell® is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language designed especially for system administration.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell® is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language designed especially for system administration.

trans-unit.source: The use of PowerShell cmdlets for Azure Site Recovery is supported between a Hyper-V site that VMM manages and Azure.
trans-unit.target: The use of PowerShell cmdlets for Azure Site Recovery is supported between a Hyper-V site that VMM manages and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of deployment scenarios see the [Azure Site Recovery overview](site-recovery-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of deployment scenarios see the [Azure Site Recovery overview](site-recovery-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying Azure Site Recovery, including orchestrating and automating protection for workloads running on virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers that are located in VMM private clouds.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying Azure Site Recovery, including orchestrating and automating protection for workloads running on virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers that are located in VMM private clouds.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, virtual machines are replicated from a primary VMM site to Azure using Hyper-V Replica.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, virtual machines are replicated from a primary VMM site to Azure using Hyper-V Replica.

trans-unit.source: The article includes prerequisites for the scenario, and shows you how to set up a Site Recovery vault, install the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the source VMM server, register the server in the vault, add an Azure storage account, install the Azure Recovery Services agent on Hyper-V host servers, configure protection settings for VMM clouds that will be applied to all protected virtual machines, and then enable protection for those virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The article includes prerequisites for the scenario, and shows you how to set up a Site Recovery vault, install the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the source VMM server, register the server in the vault, add an Azure storage account, install the Azure Recovery Services agent on Hyper-V host servers, configure protection settings for VMM clouds that will be applied to all protected virtual machines, and then enable protection for those virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Finish up by testing the failover to make sure everything's working as expected.
trans-unit.target: Finish up by testing the failover to make sure everything's working as expected.

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems setting up this scenario, post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=313628).
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems setting up this scenario, post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=313628).

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have these prerequisites in place:
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have these prerequisites in place:

trans-unit.source: Azure prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Azure prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You'll need a [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/) account.
trans-unit.target: You'll need a [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/) account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one, start with a [free trial](http://aka.ms/try-azure).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one, start with a [free trial](http://aka.ms/try-azure).

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can read about [Azure Site Recovery Manager pricing](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=378268).
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can read about [Azure Site Recovery Manager pricing](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=378268).

trans-unit.source: You'll need an Azure storage account to store data replicated to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You'll need an Azure storage account to store data replicated to Azure.

trans-unit.source: The account needs geo-replication enabled.
trans-unit.target: The account needs geo-replication enabled.

trans-unit.source: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery service, and be associated with the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery service, and be associated with the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about setting up Azure storage, see [Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=398704).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about setting up Azure storage, see [Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=398704).

trans-unit.source: You'll need to make sure that virtual machines you want to protect comply with Azure requirements.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to make sure that virtual machines you want to protect comply with Azure requirements.

trans-unit.source: See [Virtual machine support](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469078.aspx#BKMK_E2A) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Virtual machine support](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469078.aspx#BKMK_E2A) for details.

trans-unit.source: VMM prerequisites
trans-unit.target: VMM prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You'll need VMM server running on System Center 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: You'll need VMM server running on System Center 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Any VMM server containing virtual machines you want to protect must be running the Azure Site Recovery Provider.
trans-unit.target: Any VMM server containing virtual machines you want to protect must be running the Azure Site Recovery Provider.

trans-unit.source: This is installed during the Azure Site Recovery deployment.
trans-unit.target: This is installed during the Azure Site Recovery deployment.

trans-unit.source: You'll need at least one cloud on the VMM server you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: You'll need at least one cloud on the VMM server you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: The cloud should contain:
trans-unit.target: The cloud should contain:

trans-unit.source: One or more VMM host groups.
trans-unit.target: One or more VMM host groups.

trans-unit.source: One or more Hyper-V host servers or clusters in each host group .
trans-unit.target: One or more Hyper-V host servers or clusters in each host group .

trans-unit.source: One or more virtual machines on the source Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: One or more virtual machines on the source Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about setting up VMM clouds:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about setting up VMM clouds:

trans-unit.source: Read more about private VMM clouds in [What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324952) and in [VMM 2012 and the clouds](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324956).
trans-unit.target: Read more about private VMM clouds in [What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324952) and in [VMM 2012 and the clouds](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324956).

trans-unit.source: Learn about [Configuring the VMM cloud fabric](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469075.aspx#BKMK_Fabric)
trans-unit.target: Learn about [Configuring the VMM cloud fabric](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn469075.aspx#BKMK_Fabric)

trans-unit.source: After your cloud fabric elements are in place learn about creating private clouds in [Creating a private cloud in VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324953) and [Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324954).
trans-unit.target: After your cloud fabric elements are in place learn about creating private clouds in [Creating a private cloud in VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324953) and [Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=324954).

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The host Hyper-V servers must be running at least Windows Server 2012 with Hyper-V role and have the latest updates installed.
trans-unit.target: The host Hyper-V servers must be running at least Windows Server 2012 with Hyper-V role and have the latest updates installed.

trans-unit.source: If you're running Hyper-V in a cluster note that cluster broker isn't created automatically if you have a static IP address-based cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you're running Hyper-V in a cluster note that cluster broker isn't created automatically if you have a static IP address-based cluster.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to configure the cluster broker manually.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to configure the cluster broker manually.

trans-unit.source: For instructions see [Configure Hyper-V Replica Broker](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=403937).
trans-unit.target: For instructions see [Configure Hyper-V Replica Broker](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=403937).

trans-unit.source: Any Hyper-V host server or cluster for which you want to manage protection must be included in a VMM cloud.
trans-unit.target: Any Hyper-V host server or cluster for which you want to manage protection must be included in a VMM cloud.

trans-unit.source: Network mapping prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Network mapping prerequisites

trans-unit.source: When you protect virtual machines in Azure network mapping maps between VM networks on the source VMM server and target Azure networks to enable the following:
trans-unit.target: When you protect virtual machines in Azure network mapping maps between VM networks on the source VMM server and target Azure networks to enable the following:

trans-unit.source: All machines which fail over on the same network can connect to each other, irrespective of which recovery plan they are in.
trans-unit.target: All machines which fail over on the same network can connect to each other, irrespective of which recovery plan they are in.

trans-unit.source: If a network gateway is setup on the target Azure network, virtual machines can connect to other on-premises virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If a network gateway is setup on the target Azure network, virtual machines can connect to other on-premises virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t configure network mapping only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan will be able to connect to each other after failover to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t configure network mapping only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan will be able to connect to each other after failover to Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you want to deploy network mapping you'll need the following:
trans-unit.target: If you want to deploy network mapping you'll need the following:

trans-unit.source: The virtual machines you want to protect on the source VMM server should be connected to a VM network.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machines you want to protect on the source VMM server should be connected to a VM network.

trans-unit.source: That network should be linked to a logical network that is associated with the cloud.
trans-unit.target: That network should be linked to a logical network that is associated with the cloud.

trans-unit.source: An Azure network to which replicated virtual machines can connect after failover.
trans-unit.target: An Azure network to which replicated virtual machines can connect after failover.

trans-unit.source: You'll select this network at the time of failover.
trans-unit.target: You'll select this network at the time of failover.

trans-unit.source: The network should be in the same region as your Azure Site Recovery subscription.
trans-unit.target: The network should be in the same region as your Azure Site Recovery subscription.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about network mapping:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about network mapping:

trans-unit.source: Configuring logical networking in VMM
trans-unit.target: Configuring logical networking in VMM

trans-unit.source: Configuring VM networks and gateways in VMM
trans-unit.target: Configuring VM networks and gateways in VMM

trans-unit.source: Configure and monitor virtual networks in Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure and monitor virtual networks in Azure

trans-unit.source: PowerShell prerequisites
trans-unit.target: PowerShell prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.

trans-unit.source: If you are already using PowerShell, you'll need to upgrade to version 0.8.10 or later.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using PowerShell, you'll need to upgrade to version 0.8.10 or later.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting up PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about setting up PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Once you have set up and configured PowerShell, you can view all of the available cmdlets for the service [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn850420.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Once you have set up and configured PowerShell, you can view all of the available cmdlets for the service [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn850420.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To learn about tips that can help you use the cmdlets, such as how parameter values, inputs, and outputs are typically handled in Azure PowerShell, see [Get Started with Azure Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj554332.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To learn about tips that can help you use the cmdlets, such as how parameter values, inputs, and outputs are typically handled in Azure PowerShell, see [Get Started with Azure Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj554332.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Step 8: Configure network mapping
trans-unit.target: Step 8: Configure network mapping

trans-unit.source: Before you begin network mapping verify that virtual machines on the source VMM server are connected to a VM network.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin network mapping verify that virtual machines on the source VMM server are connected to a VM network.

trans-unit.source: In addition, create one or more Azure virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: In addition, create one or more Azure virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: Note that multiple VM networks can be mapped to a single Azure network.
trans-unit.target: Note that multiple VM networks can be mapped to a single Azure network.

trans-unit.source: Note that if the target network has multiple subnets and one of those subnets has the same name as subnet on which the source virtual machine is located, then the replica virtual machine will be connected to that target subnet after failover.
trans-unit.target: Note that if the target network has multiple subnets and one of those subnets has the same name as subnet on which the source virtual machine is located, then the replica virtual machine will be connected to that target subnet after failover.

trans-unit.source: If there is not a target subnet with a matching name, the virtual machine will be connected to the first subnet in the network.
trans-unit.target: If there is not a target subnet with a matching name, the virtual machine will be connected to the first subnet in the network.

trans-unit.source: The first command gets servers for the current Azure Site Recovery vault.
trans-unit.target: The first command gets servers for the current Azure Site Recovery vault.

trans-unit.source: The command stores the Microsoft Azure Site Recovery servers in the $Servers array variable.
trans-unit.target: The command stores the Microsoft Azure Site Recovery servers in the $Servers array variable.

trans-unit.source: The second command gets the site recovery network for the first server in the $Servers array.
trans-unit.target: The second command gets the site recovery network for the first server in the $Servers array.

trans-unit.source: The command stores the networks in the $Networks variable.
trans-unit.target: The command stores the networks in the $Networks variable.

trans-unit.source: The third command gets your Azure subscriptions by using the Get-AzureSubscription cmdlet, and then stores that value in the $Subscriptions variable.
trans-unit.target: The third command gets your Azure subscriptions by using the Get-AzureSubscription cmdlet, and then stores that value in the $Subscriptions variable.

trans-unit.source: The fourth command gets Azure virtual networks by using the Get-AzureVNetSite cmdlet, and then that value in the $AzureVmNetworks variable.
trans-unit.target: The fourth command gets Azure virtual networks by using the Get-AzureVNetSite cmdlet, and then that value in the $AzureVmNetworks variable.

trans-unit.source: The final cmdlet creates a mapping between the primary network and the Azure virtual machine network.
trans-unit.target: The final cmdlet creates a mapping between the primary network and the Azure virtual machine network.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet specifies the primary network as the first element of $Networks.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet specifies the primary network as the first element of $Networks.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet specifies a virtual machine network as the first element of $AzureVmNetworks by using its ID.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet specifies a virtual machine network as the first element of $AzureVmNetworks by using its ID.

trans-unit.source: The command includes your Azure subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: The command includes your Azure subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Step 9: Enable protection for virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Step 9: Enable protection for virtual machines

trans-unit.source: After servers, clouds, and networks are configured correctly, you can enable protection for virtual machines in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: After servers, clouds, and networks are configured correctly, you can enable protection for virtual machines in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Note the following:
trans-unit.target: Note the following:

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines must meet Azure requirements.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines must meet Azure requirements.

trans-unit.source: Check these in Prerequisites and support in the Planning guide.
trans-unit.target: Check these in Prerequisites and support in the Planning guide.

trans-unit.source: To enable protection the operating system and operating system disk properties must be set for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To enable protection the operating system and operating system disk properties must be set for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: When you create a virtual machine in VMM using a virtual machine template you can set the property.
trans-unit.target: When you create a virtual machine in VMM using a virtual machine template you can set the property.

trans-unit.source: You can also set these properties for existing virtual machines on the **General** and **Hardware Configuration** tabs of the virtual machine properties.
trans-unit.target: You can also set these properties for existing virtual machines on the **General** and **Hardware Configuration** tabs of the virtual machine properties.

trans-unit.source: If you don't set these properties in VMM you'll be able to configure them in the Azure Site Recovery portal.
trans-unit.target: If you don't set these properties in VMM you'll be able to configure them in the Azure Site Recovery portal.

trans-unit.source: To enable protection, run the following command to get the protection container:
trans-unit.target: To enable protection, run the following command to get the protection container:

trans-unit.source: Get the protection entity (VM) by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: Get the protection entity (VM) by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: $TemplatePath = "C:\RPTemplatePath.xml";
trans-unit.target: $TemplatePath = "C:\RPTemplatePath.xml";

trans-unit.source: $jobIDResult = Start-AzureSiteRecoveryTestFailoverJob -RecoveryPlan $RPObject -Direction PrimaryToRecovery;
trans-unit.target: $jobIDResult = Start-AzureSiteRecoveryTestFailoverJob -RecoveryPlan $RPObject -Direction PrimaryToRecovery;

trans-unit.source: Do
trans-unit.target: Do

trans-unit.source: $job = Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -Id $associationJob.JobId;
trans-unit.target: $job = Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -Id $associationJob.JobId;

trans-unit.source: Write-Host "Job State:{0}, StateDescription:{1}" -f Job.State, $job.StateDescription;
trans-unit.target: Write-Host "Job State:{0}, StateDescription:{1}" -f Job.State, $job.StateDescription;

trans-unit.source: if($job -eq $null -or $job.StateDescription -ne "Completed")
trans-unit.target: if($job -eq $null -or $job.StateDescription -ne "Completed")

trans-unit.source: $isJobLeftForProcessing = $true;
trans-unit.target: $isJobLeftForProcessing = $true;

trans-unit.source: if($isJobLeftForProcessing)
trans-unit.target: if($isJobLeftForProcessing)

trans-unit.source: Start-Sleep -Seconds 60
trans-unit.target: Start-Sleep -Seconds 60

trans-unit.source: }While($isJobLeftForProcessing)
trans-unit.target: }While($isJobLeftForProcessing)
